Name: Stadia, Inspection
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the inspection of stadia.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Section 27-232 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new definition to be placed alphabetically and immediately following the term "STACK VENT" to read as follows:
      STADIUM.	The physical structure of a city-owned or operated arena used for sporting, musical, cultural or other similar events, including all spaces and areas, enclosed or unenclosed, within or under, between the outer and inner boundaries of such physical structure, including, but not limited to, all improvements, additions, alterations, fixtures, equipment, exterior ticket booths and other installations therein or thereon constructed, provided or added at any time by the city or by any entity pursuant to an agreement with the city or by a subcontractor thereto, and used in connection with the operation of the stadium.
	ï¿½2.  Title 27 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 27-127.1 to read as follows:
	?27-127.1	Stadium inspections.  The commissioner shall cause each stadium in the city of New York to be inspected on site once every year by a city employee who is a professional engineer licensed by the state of New York.  Such inspection shall at a minimum be performed to determine the physical condition and the structural integrity of such stadium.  No stadium in the city of New York shall be utilized for public or private events unless such stadium has been inspected within the immediately preceding one-year period and determined to be in a safe condition.  Should any stadium be deemed to be in an unsafe condition, the certificate of occupancy for such stadium shall be revoked until all such unsafe conditions shall have been corrected and such stadium shall have been reinspected by a professional engineer licensed by the state of New York.  The commissioner shall submit a written report to the council certifying the results of such inspections and any subsequent inspections that may occur during the same year not later than thirty days after the completion of each inspection.  Such report shall clearly document the condition of the stadium and must be signed by and bear the professional seal of the engineer that performed the inspection.
	?3. This local law shall take effect thirty days after its enactment.
